meanings: (회의·행사 등이) open, be held, take place

phrases.phrase: 가방이 열려 있고 안에 있던 귀중품이 없어졌습니다.
meanings: 호텔에서 My briefcase was opened and something important was stolen.

vlive.korean: 아 여기 열려있네 - 뭐야? 열려있었어? Oh, it's open here. - What? It's open? 듣기 View video 내 전공은 힙합(My major is HIPHOP) : Ep 23. 현재 1위 츄플에게 도전하는 경희대 래빈 & 용인 리퍼블릭!
vlive.english: Oh, it's open here. - What? It's open?

vlive.korean: 심지어 결말이 열려있어 - 뮤비 현장이 과연 어떨지가... It even has an open ending. - How the MV set will be... 듣기 View video NCT : 127💚니가좋아💚
vlive.english: It even has an open ending. - How the MV set will be...

vlive.korean: 왜 문이 열려있지? Why is this door open? 듣기 View video 컨스TV : 웹드라마 [기적 소녀 4화] 절대 뒤돌아 보지마!
"야 문이 열려있잖아!" "Hey! The door is open!" 듣기 View video Park Bo Young : 안자는사람!!!
여기 문이 이렇게 열려 있는데 왜 그렇게 가... Here is the door. Why would you ... 듣기 View video 콬TV (WHYNOT) : 나는 누구를 좋아하는 걸까 [연애미수] EP04
vlive.english: Here is the door. Why would you ...

examples.korean: The tournament is open to both amateurs and professionals. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 그 대회는 아마추어 선수와 프로 선수 모두에게 열려 있다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: The tournament is open to both amateurs and professionals. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: The event is open to all comers. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 본 행사는 관심 있는 사람 모두에게 열려 있습니다[관심 있는 사람이면 누구나 참가할 수 있습니다]. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: The event is open to all comers. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: Several avenues are open to us. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 우리에게는 몇 가지 길이 열려 있다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: Several avenues are open to us. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: Her blouse had come undone. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 그녀의 블라우스는 단추가 끌러져[앞섶이 열려] 있었다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: Her blouse had come undone. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: ‘It opens like this.’ ‘Oh, I see.’ 듣기 Add to Wordbook “이건 이렇게 열려.” “아, 알겠어.” Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: ‘It opens like this.’ ‘Oh, I see.’ Add to Wordbook
